reviews.review_msg: Scott is one of the most accessible and reasonable prof I have encountered. He tried out this thing for our covid semester called one week extension with no excuse needed. It fixed my studying habits with procrastination. There are many nice things I can say about him, but he is both a researcher and teacher. He sometimes teaches by not teaching.

I LOVE SCOTT! Just had for the fall 2020 semester and he has an absolute beauty! It was my first semester at SFU and he made it so easy to learn. Class discussions and lectures are very engaging! Scott wants you to do well and is always willing to make time for you. All I can say is I wish I could've taken this class in person. All the best Scott:)

One of my favourite professors ever! Very caring & really wants us to succeed. He's very open to suggestions on improving his class & responds to emails quickly. He gives lots of assignments so even if you do poorly on one, you can try to improve your grade with the next assignment. Really genuine & passionate about social psyc. Take his class!
One of the coolest professors at SFU. Psyc 363 with him is probably my favourite course I've taken during my undergrad so far.
Awesome class covering interesting and relevant topics! Scott clearly cares about his students and works hard to make the course engaging while keeping it clear and comprehensible.

Really enjoyed the class, lectures where interesting as well funny! Assignments where very clear as well interesting. He is easy to talk to as well will reply to emails quickly. Participation matters and exams are usually lecture heavy so best to go to class! Lectures are also recorded which helps with his slides
Interesting class and good first time instructor. a 3 hour lecture is tough but Scott tried to make it relevant to issues going on today which was eye opening.

I really enjoyed this class and think Scott was an engaging lecturer. He was always prepared, tries to make it interesting and clearly cares about the topic. You need to work for your grade, participate and take good notes since he doesn't spoon feed everything to you.

Class was divided by 3 papers, in class participation, and exams that are non-cumulative. I took the class the first time Scott taught the class. He seemed to care about the subject being taught Lectures would often start with a quick recap, that was not quick (30-50 minutes), lecture style is really structured and feels rehearsed.

It takes a really long time to get back marks for this class (not fully his fault I guess). Other than that, I think he is doing his best, and he handles sensitive topics very well. The papers for this class were fun, and the quizzes/midterm are easy. The midterm q's had double negatives so hopefully he'll get rid of those for future classes

Scott is great! He takes the time to explain things and is super tactful with touchy topics. He has interesting views and got me interested in many new things this semester! Really inspiring and hilarious! TA's were terrible at marking papers this time though. Mad inconsistent.

He is a new instructor here. felt like he was presenting instead of teaching in the beginning, but start getting better. no useful textbook, only his not so clear notes but luckily he records his lecture talk on canvas. papers with interesting topics. we wrote a 1000 words paper about crazy rich asians' stereotype.

Scott is a wonderful but he needs to work on his teaching style. His lecture slides were too vague. But it was nice of him to have recordings so one can go back and refer to it. He gives you many opportunities to boost your mark like participation marks, quiz, 2 papers, reflection paper, midterm and final but his tests are hard. Interesting class!

Scott is a nice guy and tries his hardest. That being said, you can also tell that he's new and tries too hard not to step on anyone's toes. Too much time on "the fuzzies" as someone has already said, and the paper marking was terrible by the TAs. I have faith he'll improve, but wasn't my favourite this semester.

Absolutely amazing and kind hearted prof. He acknowledges each student's concern. Super accessible and very helpful, and he does everything to help his students! Lots of opportunity to get marks through papers, participation through in class activities and two exams. Course material is horrible. This should be a sociology course, not a psyc course

Spends too much time on "Fuzzies" which are questions about previous material, if students feel they are confused they should make time in office hours, Scott shouldn't allocate nearly 30-45 minutes to discuss past material that few are mistaken on. Assignments clearly defined, but grading system not explained well enough/ is based on TA's opinion

2 papers, a midterm and mc only final. In class activities every class so u have to come, they pick random one's to mark. only TA's mark papers, talk to them before papers are due! Lectures are super long and he's kind of monotone which makes everything boring. He is new to teaching so maybe he will be better in the future?

Scott's a sweet guy and has his heart in the right place. However, I found the combination of his monotone voice and novice/tough grading TA's to be a real downer. I'd recommend for you take it with someone else (for now) until Scott learns to navigate and lecture better since he's new to teaching.

Scott is a really great and understanding instructor. He puts lots of effort to make concepts that are easy to understand. His lecture overall is excellent and SUPER HELPFUL that he clears things up every class! The exams are mostly based on his lecture and papers are marked by TAs so nothing to do with him. Definitely would take him again.
